revised_title: Respiratory Virus Infections and Performance: Effects on Human Efficiency
tldr: The study examines the effects of respiratory virus infections, such as colds and influenza, on human performance efficiency. Experimentally induced infections at the MRC Common Cold Unit showed that these illnesses can have selective effects on performance, even in subclinical infections, and may impair performance during the incubation period or after the clinical symptoms have resolved. These findings have significant implications for occupational safety and efficiency.
